intro: Erucastrum baeticum, commonly known as the Iberian cress, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in southern Europe.
